title: AG40023: Horticulture And Floriculture Technology - Quick Facts
text:
AG40023
Course name | Horticulture And Floriculture Technology
Offered by | Agricultural & Food Engineering
Credits | 3
L-T-P | 3-0-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | Autumn

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Classification of Fruit and Flower Crops: Soils and climate, Fruit and flower crops for major agro-ecological regions. Propagation Techniques: Modern techniques of raising seedlings, Vegetative propagation, Micropropagation. Nursery Management: Field management and green house technology Cultural Practices of Orchards and Flower Gardens: Planting methods, Training and prunning, Nutrient management, Biofertilizer, Fertilization, Plant hormones, Plant protection measures, microbial pesticides, Crop growth assessment. Harvest and Post Harvest: Cut flower, Dry flower, Storage preservation and packaging of fruits and flowers, Quality assessment.
